name: Wing Tek Lum
bio: Wing Tek Lum was born in Honolulu, Hawaii. He studied engineering and art at Brown University, where he was active in Vietnam War protests. Lum is the author of two books of poetry: Expounding the Doubtful Points (1987) and The Nanjing Massacre: Poems (2013), a book inspired by Iris Chang’s The Rape of Nanking (1997). Lum’s method is primarily visual; in an interview with Honolulu Magazine, he described his process: “I like to look at a moment in time and reflect on that. A lot of my poems are related to or inspired by photographs. I look at a photograph and I try to write something down—a description of what I see. I look at it again and write something more.” Lum lives in Hawaii, where he is an engineer and a real estate broker.
